system.description:
You have blended a supernatural connection to nature with a certain inherent stillness and a knack for subterfuge. You gain the following benefits:

  • Your Dexterity or Wisdom score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.

  • You learn Thieves’ Cant as if you had the @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-backgrounds.Item.pvr4i8s3zkuroeuc]{Criminal} background. If you already know Thieves’ Cant, you learn another language from the following list: Aquan, Auran, Ignan, Primordial, Sylvan, or Terran.

  • If you're speaking to another character that knows both Druidic and Thieves' Cant, you can make communication with them completely unintelligible to all other outside parties by combining the Druidic language with the euphemisms and double meanings of Thieves' Cant.

  • You may use your @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.3jdfihvtbyhbv9ez]{Wild Shaped} form's natural weapons and any weapon you have enhanced with @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-spells.Item.zaeerhaj7ici4dtd]{Shillelagh} with @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.4727pnvz5nwn3h23]{Sneak Attack}.

  • Half your druid levels count as rogue levels for the purpose of the @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.e5mepl86zsavxhrp]{Self-Preservation} feature.

  • Half your rogue levels count as druid levels for the purpose of the @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.l3qkjox9faldupcy]{Druidic Lore} feature.

  • You gain proficiency with the Stealth skill or an expertise die if you are already proficient.
system.prerequisite: 3 levels in druid, 3 levels in rogue
